newsitem.title: JAPAN: NTT Data to create student electronic money system.
newsitem.headline: NTT Data to create student electronic money system.

text.p: NTT Data Corp said on Friday it would create in November an electronic money system for a large student association in Tokyo, which groups 59 universities and 430,000 students.
NTT Data, a unit of Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp, said the order is the largest it has ever received for electronic money systems for closed circles.
An NTT spokesman would not disclose the sum of the order.
The system will allow students to shop at university cooperatives using prepaid cards, after transferring their money from their bank accounts through special terminals installed at universities.
Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi, Dai-Ichi Kangyo Bank and Fuji Bank will cooperate in the project, the spokesman said.
The use of the prepaid card will be limited to one campus per student for the time being, he said.
